member.summary: Implements operations for and represents the catalog search paramters. (Inherits .)

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters
member.summary: Search parameters that can be specified to control what SQL Command is executed on the server.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the join used in the query. The example types are: inner join, outer join, left join and right join.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinSourceTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the join source table. This value has to be a table name that exists in original query. For example it will be CatalogEntry for the Catalog Entry Search or CatalogNode for the Catalog Node Search.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinTargetQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets the join target query. This can either be a table name or a complete query. For exammple the table name can be something like CatalogEntryEx for the Catalog Entry search. This particular join will allow sorting by meta fields. This is not possible without a join. In some cases the target table can contain multiple records for the same record in source table. That will cause problems with constraints that are inforces by the search DTOs. In order to overcome this, you can specify the query, so if our CatalogEntryEx table had multiple records for one CatalogEntry, we would join it using the follow query: (select distinct ObjectId, DisplayName from CatalogEntryEx) CatalogEntryEx

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinSourceTableKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the join source table key.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.JoinTargetTableKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the join target table key.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.AdvancedFreeTextSearchPhrase
member.summary: Gets or sets the advanced free text search phrase. You can use advanced keywords for Microsoft Full-Text search engine.
member.value: The advanced free text search phrase.

member.summary: Gets or sets the free text search phrase.

member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL where clause. You can specify filter conditions against the tables returned by the query.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Shared.SearchParameters.SqlMetaWhereClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL meta where clause. You can specify filters for meta tables. Make sure to specifiy columns that exist for items searched.

member.summary: Gets or sets the order by clause.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Security.PermissionRecord.Merge(Mediachase.Commerce.Catalog.Security.PermissionRecord)
member.summary: This method merges the supplied permissions with the current permissions to come up with an updated permission set. The logic is that and Implied Allow overrides an Implied Deny, but and Explicit Deny overrides an Implicit Allow, while an Explicit Allow overrides an Explicit Deny. This gives us a least restrictive security system.
member.param: The permission to merge with the current permission set

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Orders.PaymentPlan.MaxCyclesCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the max cycles count. So for instance if you want to charge customer for a year each month, set CycleMode to month, CycleLength to 1 and MaxCyclesCount to 12. Leave at 0 if you never want this cycle to end.

member.summary: Gift promotion reward. Allows promotion engine to specify discount that requires item to be added to the cart. The add operation will be performed by the custom code either in workflow activity or front end source code.

member.summary: Implements operations for the promotion reward.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.PromotionReward.RewardType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the Reward. The types can be: - WholeOrder will adjust the total for the whole order - AllAffectedEntries will split adjustment between all the entries, so if discount was $50 and there are 5 entries, each one will be discount $10 - EachAffectedEntry will apply full discount to each entry, so if discount was $50 and there are 5 entries the total discount will be $250

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the amount. Can be either Percentage or Value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the add strategy.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward.Strategy.AddWhenNeeded
member.summary: Add item when it does not exist in the cart already, if it does, then simply make it 100% discounted.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward.Strategy.AlwaysAdd
member.summary: Always adds another item even if one already exists in the cart.

member.name: F:Mediachase.Commerce.Marketing.Objects.GiftPromotionReward.Strategy.NeverAdd
member.summary: Customer must explicitly add item to the cart in order for the promotion to be applied.

member.summary:
Checks permissions in the following order: 1. Check permissions for the organization active user belongs to. 2. Check permissions for the role user belongs to. 3. Check permissions for the user himself.
The later check overrides the previous one if permission is explicitely defined.
